Bowtie icon font

New icons:

  • bowtie-{{icon.name}} ({{icon.unicode}})

For VSTS, the Bowtie icon font is already referenced in the core CSS. Here are the key CSS classes to be aware of: .bowtie-icon sets the font-family, size, color and line-height accordingly. Apply this style to the element you want to contain your icon (typically an <i>, <span>, or <div>). Next you'll want to apply the content class for the icon you want. Use the below catalog to find the class names.

Spinning animation

You can apply spinning animation to these icons by adding "bowtie-ani-spin" or "bowtie-ani-spin-pulse" classes:

Apply bowtie-ani-spin class for the bowtie-syncrhronize icon for smooth spin animation -

Apply bowtie-ani-spin-pulse class for the bowtie-spinner icon for stepped spin animation -

Stacking status icons as badges

A few UI areas may need status icons as badges to another base icon. To make a status icon badge, you need to stack a smaller version status icon (e.g. bowtie-status-success-sm or bowtie-status-warning-sm) on top of a full sized solid background shape icon ( bowtie-dot or bowtie-triangle). Apply the container's background color to the solid background shape icon so that it creates a visual "gap" between the base icon and the stacked status icon. You will also need to manually position the stacked status icons, usually at the bottom right corner of the base icon. See example:


  • bowtie-{{icon.name}}({{icon.unicode}})

    bowtie-{{icon.name}}


    Unicode: {{icon.unicode}}Version: v{{icon.version}} Group: {{icon.group}}

    Usage: {{icon.usage}}
